content.question:
Two ride-sharing companies, A and B, provide service for a certain city. A random sample of 52 trips made by Company A and a random sample of 52 trips made by Company B were selected, and the number of miles traveled for each trip was recorded. The difference between the sample means for the two companies <math alttext="open parenthesis, A minus B, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>−</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> was used to construct the 95 percent confidence interval <math alttext="open parenthesis, 1.86 comma 2.15, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1.86</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>2.15</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Which of the following is a correct interpretation of the interval?

choices.label: We are 95 percent confident that the difference in sample means for miles traveled by the two companies is between 1.86 miles and 2.15 miles.
We are 95 percent confident that the difference in population means for miles traveled by the two companies is between 1.86 miles and 2.15 miles.
The probability is 0.95 that the difference in sample means for miles traveled by the two companies is between 1.86 miles and 2.15 miles.
The probability is 0.95 that the difference in population means for miles traveled by the two companies is between 1.86 miles and 2.15 miles.
About 95 percent of the differences in miles traveled by the two companies are between 1.86 miles and 2.15 miles.

content.answer: We are 95 percent confident that the difference in population means for miles traveled by the two companies is between 1.86 miles and 2.15 miles.

topic.text: 7.7: Justifying a Claim About the Difference of Two Means Based on a Confidence Interval

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
